title: Almaty
summary: Almaty (/ˈælməti/; Kazakh pronunciation: [ɑlmɑˈtə] (listen); Cyrillic: Алматы), or Alma-Ata (Russian: Алма-Ата), and formerly Verniy (Russian: Ве́рный) (1854–1921), is the largest city in Kazakhstan, with a population of about 2 million.[5] It was the capital of Kazakhstan from 1929 to 1997,[6] when the government relocated the capital to Akmola (renamed Astana in 1998, and Nur-Sultan in 2019).
